document.docAuthor: Mynott, Julia H, Suter, Phillip J & Theischinger, Gunther
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Dinotoperla Tillyard, 1921 (Plecoptera: Gripopterygidae) using morphological characters and molecular data: Establishes two new genera, three new species and updates the larval taxonomy

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Dinotoperla Tillyard, 1921 (Plecoptera: Gripopterygidae) using morphological characters and molecular data: Establishes two new genera, three new species and updates the larval taxonomy

subSubSection.paragraph: Larva. Remarks. Kimmins (1951) described the adult male. The species was later synonymised with D.

serricauda
by McLellan (1971) . Yule (1984) reinstated
D. thwaitesi
and stated that Kimmins’ (1951) female described under
D. fontana
was actually
D. thwaitesi .
Yule (1984) mentions the habitat for the larvae but does not describe the larvae. The association with adults for
D. thwaitesi
has been confirmed using genetic methods.

adult male: Sawpit Creek at Summit Road. -36.35168, 148.56599. Collected

Colour: Dark brown with paler legs and wingpads.

Head: Dark mottling in posterior area of head; dorsal surface covered with short robust setae; a single very long robust setule present between ocelli and scape, and medially near eye. Antennae longer than body; robust, tapering slightly near the tips.

Thorax: Pronotum quadrate, width greater than length; dark mottling in medial area. Meso- and meta-nota with raised pale bosses at base of wingpads, extending into a darker sunken area; highest point of bosses with distinct patch of robust setae. Dorsal surface of all thoracic segments with long robust setae that taper to a point, hind margins with similar setae. Hind margin of metanotum with a pair of single very long robust setae either side of medial suture; anterior margin of pronotum with similar single setae present.

Legs: Outer margin of femora with scattered long fine setae, and peg-like setae in distal area; outer margin of tibiae with fringe of long fine setae; inner margin of tibiae with long robust setae present; outer surface of femora and tibiae with long robust setae tapering to a point. Distal margin with robust bladed setae present. Femora outer surface dark with pale medial spot (dark stripe near outer and inner margin may be present); tibiae with thin band in proximal area and dark stripe near inner margin. Inner surface of femora with broad dark stripes that are approx. half the length of segment.

Abdomen: Tergites with robust setae that taper to a point on surface and hind margin, setae on hind margin may have curled end which looks similar to sickle-shaped setae. Tergite X with similar setae to other tergites; hind margin raised and produced to a rounded point. Gills light, orange. Cerci shorter than abdomen; segments elongating into very long and thin segments, elongating by segment 9; long setae present until segment 13. Paraprocts broad, length subequal to basal width.
